isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - AIR SYSTEM - DEEP REDUCTION AIR SYSTEM

svcproc.title: DEEP REDUCTION AIR SYSTEM

step1.para: Air Supply. With the gear shift lever in neutral, loosen the connection at the "H" Port of the Roadranger valve until it can be determined that AIR is supplied to the valve. Reconnect the air line.

If there is NO AIR, check for a restriction in the line between the Roadranger valve and the slave valve, making sure this line is connected to the tee fitting at the LO Range or "L" Port of the slave valve.

Roadranger Valve. With the gear shift lever in neutral, disconnect the air line at the Signal Port of the reduction cylinder cover, making sure this line leads from the "SP" Port of the Roadranger valve.

step2.para: WHILE IN LOW RANGE, move the Deep Reduction Button FORWARD. There should be AIR flowing from the disconnected line. Move the button REARWARD to shut off air flow and re-connect the air line.
If the preceding conditions did not exist, the Roadranger valve is defective, or there is a restriction in the air lines.

step1.para: Reduction Cylinder ( Figure 6). If any of the seals in the reduction cylinder assembly are defective, the deep reduction shift will be affected. The degree of air lost will govern the degree of failure, from slow shifting to complete shift failure.

step2.para: Leak at O-ring A results in a slow shift to engage deep reduction gearing; pressurizing of transmission case; deep reduction gearing can be disengaged.

Leak at O-ring B results in slow shifting or complete failure to engage and disengage deep reduction gearing; steady flow of air from the exhaust port of control valve and/or cylinder cover when Deep Reduction Button is in the FORWARD position.
Leak at gasket C results in a slow shift to disengage deep reduction gearing; steady flow of air to the atmosphere.

step1.para: Insert Valve. Any constant flow of air from the exhaust port of the cylinder cover usually indicates a faulty insert valve. Exhaust should occur ONLY BRIEFLY when Deep Reduction Button is moved FORWARD WHILE IN LOW RANGE.
A faulty insert valve, leaking at the O-rings of the valve O.D. or from inner seals will result in shift failure. Two indications of defective O-rings or seals are:

step2.para: CONSTANT AIR flowing from the exhaust port of the cylinder cover.
CONSTANT AIR flowing from the exhaust port "E" of the control valve WHILE DEEP REDUCTION BUTTON IS REARWARD (providing the control valve is operating properly).

svcproc.para: The three O-rings in position on the valve O.D. can be replaced. However, if an inner seal is damaged, the complete assembly MUST be replaced.
